alert.note: Alert for Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Yakutat; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 3:28PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...A STORM FORCE LOW FOR MID WEEK... A strong low over the Gulf of Alaska will bring a storm force front to the panhandle for the middle of the week. This system will bring increased winds along the outer coast. Wind gusts could range from 40 to 60 mph. Forecast guidance today continues to show a strong front impacting the area Wednesday morning to Thursday morning. As such, confidence in this system continues to increase. Most places look to see their strongest winds during the day and into the evening on Wednesday. Winds behind the front are expected to decrease after the front moves through but post frontal winds are expected to be 20 to 30 mph before further decreasing on Thursday. This is an evolving and changing situation. Stay tuned to the National Weather Service for updates at weather.gov/Juneau.
